channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: China Says 'Please Stop Buying Our Bonds'
item.description: Plunging bond yields are a symptom of economic weakness that are easier to fix than curing the country’s troubled economy.

item.title: The 2024 presidential election is entering its most volatile period for the stock market
item.description: There is still no green light for the stock market as the 2024 presidential election season gets into full swing. The S&P 500’s historical performance during election years suggests stocks could experience a lackluster and volatile period between now and Nov. 5.

item.title: AstraZeneca Is a Cancer Leader. Obesity Could Be a Bonus.
item.description: The Anglo-Swedish drugmaker remains one of the best bets in Big Pharma, and potential success in obesity isn’t priced in to the stock.

item.title: Lowe’s misses sales forecasts, says it can’t call a home-improvement bottom
item.description: Lowe’s stock fell Tuesday, after the home improvement retailer reported fiscal second-quarter sales that missed expectations, as customers continued to hold back on spending on larger do-it-yourself projects.

item.title: The New Onsemi Is Worth Turning Back On
item.description: An auto inventory pileup has dented the chip maker’s valuation, but a new margin structure and AI potential make the stock a worthy bet.

item.title: U.S. job gains have likely been exaggerated. Now we’ll find out by how much.
item.description: The U.S. created a remarkable 242,000 jobs a month from the spring of 2023 to the spring of 2024, when the economy was thought be slowing down. Or did it?

item.title: Elon Musk's Twitter Takeover Is Now the Worst Buyout for Banks Since the Financial Crisis
item.description: Loans of around $13 billion have remained “hung” for nearly two years, bringing in interest payments but weighing on banks’ balance sheets.

item.title: Wells Fargo to sell commercial-mortgage-servicing unit to Trimont
item.description: The deal will make Trimont the largest servicer of commercial loans in the United States, the company said.

item.title: A Natural-Gas Glut Is Forcing Drillers to Dial Back---Again
item.description: An oversupply of the power-plant fuel persists despite some of the hottest weather on record.

item.title: Kroger expected to price seven-part bond deal that may be the biggest of the year
item.description: Kroger Co. is expected to price what may be the biggest bond deal of 2024 later Tuesday, a seven-part deal that will be used to help fund its $25 billion planed merger with Albertsons Cos.
